holidays.name: World Health Day
holidays.description: A day dedicated to global health awareness, marking the founding of the World Health Organization in 1948. It encourages everyone to focus on health issues and wellness worldwide.
holidays.origin: Established by the World Health Organization in 1948 to commemorate its founding.
holidays.funFact: Each year, World Health Day focuses on a different health theme, ranging from mental health to climate change's impact on health.

holidays.origin: Started by a magazine editor in the UK in the 1980s as a way to encourage relaxation and self-care.
holidays.funFact: No Housework Day is celebrated every year on the Saturday after Easter, giving people a break after the busy holiday.

holidays.name: National Coffee Cake Day

holidays.origin: Became popular in the US as a way to honor this beloved breakfast treat.

holidays.name: Festival of Astrology
holidays.description: An unconventional day for astrology enthusiasts to cast horoscopes, share zodiac insights, and celebrate cosmic mysteries.
holidays.origin: Informally embraced by astrology fans around the world, gaining popularity on social media.
holidays.funFact: On this day, many astrologers release special forecasts and prediction videos, making it a starry social media hotspot.
